page.title: 12SHOPWYKE
page.content: Village. Leading from the village towards Chichester is a straight road with Gravel Pits on either side and wheat fields. There are ten cottages and a Kingdom hall if the Jehaovahs witnesses. There is also the Portfield Depot of the Water Authority and the local Driving Test Centre. Almost all the land around the villages is used for arable farming. Crops grown include wheat, barley, oats and peas. There are also some sheep and cows. There are many modern houses built of bricks and tiles. Some are very large gardens. There are also cottages of flint but very few houses have thatched roofs. The houses are Council or Private. The now water filled Gravel Pits are used for leisure. The ground itself is very much clay. (by Holly W.)
